alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 2:16AM MDT until July 24 at 3:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN MORA COUNTY... At 216 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated additional showers moving into the warned area over northern portions of the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area, potentially leading to excessive runoff and a continuation of debris flows near and into the Mora River. The debris flow can consist of water, ash, soot, rock, mud, burned vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Heavier rainfall from earlier along with additional shower activitiy will keep the threat for burn scar flash flooding and debris flows. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Debris flows or rapid torrents of water, rocks, ash, soot and burned timber will be capable of carving a destructive path down the Mora River near Holman and southeastward. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mora, Cleveland, Holman, La Cueva and Golondrinas. This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 22 and 43. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 94 near Mile Marker 18. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 4. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 3. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: vels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Pk- Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
